articles.author: Rich Mckay
articles.description: Suspected Georgia high school shooter Colt Gray was set on Friday to appear in state court where he faces murder charges stemming from Wednesday's rampage that killed four people and wounded nine others.
articles.title: Teen suspected in Georgia school shooting to appear in court

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A New York judge on Friday delayed former U.S. President Donald Trump's sentencing on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star until after the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Judge delays Trump hush money sentencing until after election

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Any Iranian transfer of ballistic missiles to Russia would mark a sharp escalation in the Ukraine war, the United States said on Friday, following reports that the two countries had deepened ties in recent weeks with such an arms transfer.
articles.title: US sees potential Iran transfer of missiles to Russia as alarming

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire in a school in central Kenya has burnt 16 students beyond recognition, Citizen Television said on Friday.
articles.title: Kenya school blaze burns 16 students beyond recognition, media say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's opposition senators are uniting around the possibility of blocking controversial judicial reforms pushed by President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, which will go to a vote next week, suggesting its passage might not be as easy as first thought.
articles.title: Mexico's opposition seeks to block judicial reform in the Senate

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 12 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Friday, medics said, as health officials resumed vaccination of tens of thousands more children in the enclave against polio.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 12 Palestinians in Gaza as polio vaccination resumes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron discussed the importance of maintaining support for Ukraine and the need for a ceasefire in Gaza during talks on Friday with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, said the French presidency.
articles.title: Macron discussed support for Ukraine and Gaza ceasefire with Germany's Scholz

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A former mafia hitman who was already serving life in prison was sentenced to 25 years in custody on Friday for the killing of notorious Boston mobster James "Whitey" Bulger in his prison cell in 2018.
articles.title: Ex-hitman gets 25 years in US prison for 'Whitey' Bulger's killing

articles.author: Lamine Chikhi
articles.description: Algeria's military-backed president is coasting towards Saturday's election all but certain to win five more years in a vote with no serious rivals after using higher gas revenues to splurge on social benefits.
articles.title: Algerian president prepares for Saturday election facing little competition

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Boeing's Starliner spacecraft undocked from the International Space Station on Friday, leaving behind its first crew of U.S. astronauts to return to Earth empty and finish a drawn-out test mission fraught with technical issues.
articles.title: Without astronauts, Boeing's Starliner undocks from space station
